## Classifying an image with teamlucc

First load the `devtools` package, used for installing `teamlucc`.

```{r}
if (!require(devtools)) install.packages('devtools')
```

```{r}
if (!require(teamlucc)) install_github('azvoleff/teamlucc')
```

Now load the teamlucc package, using `devtools` to install it from github if it 
is not yet installed.

The first step in the classification is putting together a training dataset. `teamlucc` includes a function to output a shapefile that can be used for collecting training data:

get_extent_polys(raster_obj)

```{r}
results <- team_classify(predictor_file, train_shp, output_path, class_col, 
                         training, n_cpus, overwrite, notify)
```
